articles.title: Papers Call for Boosting DPRK-China Friendship
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Meets Chinese Friendship Delegation 
   Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju met and had a friendly talk with a Chinese friendship delegation led by Hui Liangyu, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
 Present there were the governor of Jilin Province and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe who are members of the delegation and other members and officials of the Chinese embassy here.   
  On hand were Minister of Agriculture Ri Kyong Sik and others, officials concerned.

DPRK and China Cooperate in Economic and Technological Field 
   Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- An agreement on economic and technological cooperation between the DPRK and Chinese governments was signed here on Monday.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Kwak Pom Gi, Minister of Public Health Kim Su Hak who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Vice Department Director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea Pak Kyong Son, Vice-Minister of Agriculture Kim Yong Suk, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Jon Yong Jin and officials concerned and from the Chinese side members of the Chinese  friendship delegation led by Hui Liangyu, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and officials of the Chinese embassy here.    
  The agreement was inked by Kang Ki Man, vice-minister of Foreign Trade of the DPRK, and Chen Jian, assistant to the minister of Commerce of China.

articles.title: Cambodian King Sends Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Special Bulletin Issued in France 
   Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association issued a special bulletin on July 5 on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
 The bulletin carried an article written by the chairman of the association in which he assailed the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK and an article contributed by the vice-chairman of the association in which he accused French media of conducting false propaganda about it, toeing the U.S. line.    
 It gave an account of the meeting of the Presidium of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea held in Brussels in March last year. Printed there was an appeal to the governments, political parties, organizations of all countries and international organizations and non-governmental organizations which was adopted at the meeting. It introduced the association's activities for friendship and solidarity.

articles.content:
Norodom Sihanouk Sends Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy 
   Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Cambodian Great King Norodom Sihanouk sent a large floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
 Written on the ribbon of the basket were letters reading "Highest tribute to HE Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, president of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia."    
 On the instruction of the great king Deputy Prime Minister in charge of the Royal Palace Kong Sam Ol visited the DPRK embassy on July 8 together with the secretary of state and undersecretaries of state for the Royal Palace and laid the large floral basket before the portrait of the President and paid tribute to him.

articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Demanded in Russia
   Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia sent a letter of protest to the U.S. president on July 6 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
 The Korean nation has lived, divided into two for over 60 years owing to the U.S. forces' presence in south Korea, the letter said, stressing that the hearts of the Korean people are burning with grudge and resentment at the U.S.    
 A movement for national reunification is mounting on the Korean Peninsula, it said, adding that the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea brooks no further delay.
 The occupiers are destined to meet their miserable end, it said, urging the U.S. forces to quit south Korea at once.

North Side's Delegation to 19th Inter-Korean Ministerial Talks Leaves
    Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation led by Kwon Ho Ung, chief councilor of the Cabinet, left here Tuesday for Pusan, south Korea, to participate in the 19th inter-Korean ministerial talks.
 It was seen off at the airport by Minister of Culture Kang Nung Su, Minister of Education Kim Yong Jin, Chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Committee Jong Un Op and officials concerned.

articles.content:
Congratulations to Nigerian FM
   Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala on her appointment as foreign minister of Nigeria.
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message wholeheartedly wished her success in her new job.
